param.para: The initial number of samples to allocate.

param.name: cMaximumSamples
param.para: The maximum number of samples to allocate.

param.name: pMediaType

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Allocates video samples that contain Microsoft Direct3D 11 texture surfaces.

remarks.para: You can use this interface to allocate Direct3D 11 video samples, rather than allocate the texture surfaces and media samples directly. To get a pointer to this interface, call the function.
To allocate video samples, perform the following steps:

item.description: Obtain a pointer to the interface. For a Media Foundation transform (MFT), this step occurs during the MFT_MESSAGE_SET_D3D_MANAGER event.
Call to create the allocator object and get a pointer to the IMFVideoSampleAllocatorEx interface.
Call on the allocator to set the pointer on the allocator.
Call to get a pointer to the interface.
Set the MF_SA_D3D11_USAGE and MF_SA_D3D11_BINDFLAGS attributes.
